Conan.Action: Puts the knife to help Islene give birth, handles the situation with care and respect despite the tragic circumstances.
In the given excerpt, Conan is not present or active; focus is on Corin and Islene.
Refuses to withdraw when told he is too young, stands his ground determinedly.
Punches the largest teen in the throat after the teen attempts to shove him.
Refuses to withdraw when told he is too young, stands his ground determinedly.
Defends himself skillfully by grabbing and punching the larger teen in the throat.
Pulled the arm of a boy attempting to shove him and punched him in the throat.
Followed other boys climbing the cliff instead of taking an easier route, demonstrating determination and focus.
Navigated and outpaced other boys in the climbing and racing challenge without aggression beyond self-defense.
Stands his ground and fights three Picts when others flee.
Shows no fear or hesitation in battle, demonstrating courage rather than hostility.
Spits out the bloody stone from his mouth, a gesture of defiance or toughness rather than respect.
Seems confused why his father and others are not pleased with his violent actions, suggesting innocence or sincere misunderstanding.
Shows determination and endurance during harsh training conditions imposed by his father while maintaining focus on learning the sword.
Displays frustration and challenges his father's lesson, indicating confidence and eagerness to progress.
Listens attentively to Corin's teachings about the sword and its symbolism, showing respect and a willingness to learn.
Engages in a fierce duel and pursues victory with fury, showing aggression and competitiveness.
Attacks Corin with fury but overextends and has his sword shattered, leaving him puzzled.
Works the bellows at the forge, actively participates in sword-making.
Furrows brow, trying to understand the purpose of the sword after Corin's explanation.
Blood rushes to his face but says nothing after being told the sword is not ready; rushes out frustrated and slashes through a field of reeds in rage.
Unable to explain the sword's purpose and shows visible frustration.
Relying on instincts to spin around at a movement in the forest even though nothing is there.
Leads warriors into battle with speed and strength, effectively countering enemy charge.
Pursues retreating enemies aggressively, showing confidence and tactical initiative.
Fails to anticipate flaming arrows and resulting forest fire that kills many warriors.
Races back to confront the attackers and fights fiercely to defend his village and people.
Ruthlessly kills enemies during the battle with little indication of mercy.
Responds to his father’s call and retreats when pulled from the fight, showing respect and trust in his father’s judgment.
Races back to the village immediately upon hearing the explosion, showing quick situational awareness and urgency.
Seizes a fallen sword and kills an enemy soldier in the chaos, demonstrating combat skill and decisiveness.
Prepares himself to meet a spear charge confidently and effectively.
Is pulled out of combat by Corin despite his willingness to continue fighting, showing discipline in heeding authority.
Refuses to retreat, insists on fighting to protect his tribe.
Reacting with anguish and shouting 'No!' as his father is stabbed.
Throws attacker Lucius into the fiery forge causing severe injury.
Refuses to back down and insists on fighting despite dangerous odds.
Successfully dodges Lucius's attack and throws him into a fiery forge causing serious injury.
Is pinned under rubble from the collapsing forge after being hit by Lucius, losing physical control.
Expresses brave resolve to die with purpose when confronted by his father.
Lacks immediate situational awareness or defensive preparation as enemies burst in and take tactical advantage.
Staring back at Corin despite being buried and wounded, showing concern and connection.
Kills the Pict who is desecrating dead warriors and marks himself by cutting a notch into his arm as a sign of that kill.
Engages fiercely in an arm wrestling challenge, displaying physical prowess and confidence.
Throws a tankard of ale in fury at the barkeep, threatening violence.
Looms threateningly over smaller City Guards and threatens them with violence.
Yawns indifferently when accused, shows lack of respect or concern for authority.
Admits to past violent and criminal behavior honestly but denies recent drunkenness.
Kills two guards instantly to free himself without hesitation.
Strikes the Lieutenant to gain control and pursue his goal without regard for the man's life.
Feigns drunkenness but remains alert and sober, revealing strategic patience.
Kills guards quickly and efficiently to escape captivity.
Disarms the Lieutenant and uses physical dominance to gain the key to the cells.
Acts decisively under pressure and adapts to the immediate situation.
Decapitates Lieutenant and aggressively fights the guards without hesitation.
Calls Lucius by name and asserts identity, shows recognition of past connection.
Decapitates the Lieutenant, uses the severed head as a weapon to incapacitate a guard.
Confronts multiple armed guards confidently, using the environment (kicking the table) to gain an advantage.
Effectively disarms and incapacitates Lucius by twisting his sword and pinning him to the floor, demonstrating strength and skill.
Handles a multi-directional attack from three guards simultaneously, showing high combat competence.
Saves Lucius by pouring water on the burning guard and lifting the table to free Lucius' foot
Sears Lucius' wounded hand closed over a flame without hesitation
Smashes Lucius' face against the table to assert control, showing no hesitation or gentleness
Kills the attacking guards with ruthless efficiency, showing rage and no mercy
Gives his word to Lucius that he will not kill him and lets him go.
Despite giving his word, momentarily threatens Lucius by grabbing his head but then helps him swallow a key and rescues him as a form of 'toasting' their deal.
Frees the One-Eyed Prisoner by cutting him down and even gives him a sword to aid his escape.
Says he won't kill Lucius but allows him to be attacked, then leaves without intervening.
Hands Lucius a sword and tells him the key is in the Captain's gut, enabling Lucius to free himself.
Leaves Lucius to fend for himself against the One-Eyed Prisoner without intervening.
Walks away calmly while Lucius screams, showing emotional control and focus on his own mission.
No direct actions or involvement in this excerpt; does not intervene or influence events shown.
Grabs the Slave Trader's arm to stop him from whipping a slave, using his size to intimidate but does not engage further or intervene beyond that.
Asks the Slave Trader directly for directions to Khor Kalba, showing clear intent and confidence in navigating the desert.
Sees the suffering of slaves but chooses not to intervene beyond stopping a single whipping, then rides on without addressing the broader injustice.
Draws his sword quickly after being unseated and commands the slavers to use their whips strategically against horses' legs to entangle enemy riders.
Lodges his sword in a rolling boulder and uses it as a platform to launch an attack on approaching horsemen.
Fails to avoid injury when his horse is speared and is knocked down.
Fights aggressively to protect Tamara and attack shadow scouts threatening slaves.
Kills the remaining caravan driver without hesitation.
Unties Tamara from the horse, gives her water, and offers her a place atop his horse, keeping their bodies close while speaking quietly to her.
Dismisses Tamara's need for multiple names, indicating a blunt and straightforward communication style.
Makes a sarcastic comment about hoping Khalar Singh wants Tamara for her cooking.
Sniffs Tamara's cooking pot and jests about trying to poison him.
Dismisses Tamara's prayer, expressing cynicism about faith and fate.
Responds to Tamara's apology for his lack of faith with a curt rejection, 'I need no pity.'
Unties Tamara and gives her water, showing practical care and control of the situation.
Rejects unnecessary formalities about names, focusing on what matters.
Uses proximity and body language effectively to interrogate Tamara, demonstrating confidence and psychological insight.
Makes a sarcastic remark about Tamara's cooking and possible poisoning, showing alertness and skepticism.
Dismisses prayer and faith in favor of pragmatic acceptance of fate, indicating strong self-reliance but also rigidity.
Kicks dirt onto the fire, plunging everything into darkness before fighting and defeating enemies.
Tells Tamara not to worry about the broken enemy and calmly resumes cooking and eating with her.
Suddenly kicks dirt onto the fire to extinguish it, creating surprise and tactical advantage.
Immediately engages in fighting and quickly disables the opponent (breaking Remo's back) while eliminating other threats.
Calmly resumes normal behavior (pulling pot off fire) after combat, demonstrating composure and confidence.
Shows a lack of mercy by wanting to enjoy 'music' (presumably Remo's pain) with his meal, which could be seen as cruel but demonstrates ruthless decisiveness.
Pulls cloth from Remo's mouth, listens to his plea, but shows no mercy and threatens him with a sword to the neck
Acknowledges his people's suffering when confronting Remo
Releases Remo from torture restraints, then uses controlled intimidation and questioning to extract key information.
Calmly connects new information about 'the Queen in hiding' to prior knowledge, demonstrating quick recall and strategic thinking.
Cuts Remo's arm to make a bloodied message, stuffs parchment in his mouth, then catapults him tied to a rock towards the enemy wall, leading to Remo's death.
Carries Tamara back after finding her tied up and gagged, removes her gag, offers her food despite its rawness.
Eats raw meat himself to avoid drawing attention with fire, shows practical concern for safety.
Replies to Tamara's question about blood on his hands with a matter-of-fact, somewhat cold statement about killing only with his own sword.
Returns from hunting with food, chooses not to light a fire to avoid drawing attention, shows practical survival skills.
Calmly deals with Tamara, feeds her despite her disgust, demonstrating confidence and control.
Expresses pragmatic and experienced view on blood and violence, indicating awareness and insight.
Confronts Tamara with knowledge of Khalar Singh's actions and takes decisive stance against the enemy.
Binds and gags Tamara despite her offer of help, showing distrust and unwillingness to listen.
Silently observes and assesses the guarded Great Wall, noting defenses and enemy positions while playing with a dagger, indicating careful tactical awareness.
Allows Tamara to speak only to silence her afterwards, showing control but possibly missing opportunity for information.
Confidently explains his plan to assassinate Khalar by scaling the wall and cutting him down.
Dismisses Tamara's tactical concerns and asserts 'I will not fail' despite valid objections.
Uses Tamara as bait to draw Khalar out, demonstrating tactical boldness and strategic thinking.
Sends Tamara ahead with her mouth gagged instead of ensuring her safety.
Fiercely fights and kills four riders who ambush him without hesitation.
Charges at Khalar Singh in rage, fighting fiercely despite being outmatched.
Charges angrily without adapting to opponent's superior speed and finesse, resulting in missed attacks and being countered effectively.
Maintains resolve in a losing situation, coming at opponent with twice the fury despite disadvantage.
Fails to defend adequately, takes deep wounds and is physically dominated by opponent.
Allows Tamara to use his dagger to free herself and aid in their escape, indirectly protecting her.
Fails to foresee the trap leading to a severe injury from Khalar Singh's punch, indicating a lapse in immediate situational competence.
Coordinates or benefits from Tamara's quick thinking and resourcefulness with his dagger, contributing to a successful escape plan using an explosion to distract and injure enemies.
Escapes the dangerous situation intelligently and confidently, demonstrating skillful evasion despite the prior setback.
Feels sorrow and failure for not providing enough for his father; admits 'I've failed you father.'
Calls Tamara 'adequate' after she saves his life instead of thanking her sincerely.
Consciously acknowledges suffering will teach him purpose, showing a willingness to accept hardship as part of life.
Realizes he has no more resources (wood or bodies) to keep the fire going and acknowledges failure.
Attempts to push bodies onto the forge to maintain the fire, showing resourcefulness under pressure.
Rises quickly despite being wounded, showing confidence and physical capability, though falls back from haste.
Acknowledges Tamara's medical aid without excessive gratitude, staying pragmatic.
Immediately climbs the staircase behind the drapery, taking initiative to explore surroundings despite pain.
Engages in playful banter and swordplay with Artus, responds with humor to Artus's teasing.
Shares concern for Tamara and discusses danger ahead, indicating protection and care.
Withdraws to his room rather than openly expressing feelings or seeking support.
Tells Tamara to leave him to sleep but responds when forced to.
Questions Tamara's willingness to risk her life for royalty, showing skepticism and bluntness.
Dismisses the story of Acheron as a tall tale and shows indifference to queens and empires.
Expresses willingness to destroy civilization itself if given the chance, showing hostility to others' values.
Listens skeptically but patiently to Tamara's explanation about Acheron, showing discernment.
Attempts to rest but allows himself to be engaged in a serious conversation, balancing self-care with responsibility.
Dismisses the importance of queens and empires and shows disdain for civilization, indicating a lack of strategic consideration.
Refuses to immediately act or engage decisively after hearing about a large threat, demonstrating reluctance or passivity.
States his only debt is to his people and that it remains unpaid.
Described as never lying and never breaking a trust once given.
Does not trust others easily, remains distant and burdened by past deaths.
Is described by Artus as never lying, never breaking a trust once given, and never giving up.
Is called a stubborn ass by Tamara and Artus, implying a rigid and possibly inflexible nature.
Hands flask of mead to Tamara, shares drink, engages in light banter, makes her smile.
Sitting calmly, drinking mead and engaging in light banter after near-death experience, showing emotional resilience and confidence.
Responds to Tamara's questions about future and belief with resignation and a lack of hope, stating 'I have no future' and 'Nothing' after death.
Expresses belief in tangible realities ('the cold of steel, the warmth of flesh') dismissing intangible faith or warmth as 'fairy tales'.
States he 'dies with purpose,' showing a sense of conviction though lacking warmth or hope.
Expresses a clear and resolute worldview, showing mental clarity and acceptance of his fate with purpose.
Shrugs at deep philosophical questions about afterlife, indicating emotional detachment but also confidence in his beliefs.
Shows calm and strategic leadership under threat, giving clear orders to the pirates to evade the enemy force.
Acknowledges the danger and collaborates with others (Artus, Tamara, pirates) without dismissiveness or arrogance.
Does not show personal vulnerability or affection, but maintains focus on the survival and morale of his crew.
Recognizes the strategic danger posed by the approaching black warship and deduces that the enemy is attempting to drive them towards another approaching force from the south.
Makes a deliberate decision not to fight the larger warship directly but to give the enemy what they think they want, deceiving them.
Commands the pirates to about ship with speed and efficiency, leading an organized and swift maneuver to escape or reposition.
Shows confidence and inspires his crew by invoking the ship’s nickname "the Wasp," indicating knowledge and morale-building.
Commands to fire the harpoon repeatedly, effectively using a siege weapon to damage the enemy warship's hull, demonstrating tactical understanding and decisiveness.
Commands to hide the girl below deck, showing concern for her safety.
Expresses fury at the pirates, indicating protective instincts.
Knocks a spearman overboard, engages aggressively in battle.
Expresses eagerness for battle ('Good. I was growing weary with boredom.') and gives clear, effective commands ('Hide her below.') demonstrating confidence and leadership.
Uses agility and combat skill to knock a spearman overboard by swinging on a jib and planting feet accurately.
Cuts through a spearman and maintains clear focus on the main opponent, showing combat skill and tactical awareness.
Drops his sword and grabs the spear as it passes by, using it to unbalance Ukafa and gain advantage.
Turns the spear against Ukafa, forcing him to retreat despite close misses.
Butts Ukafa in the head after being bitten, showing presence of mind and physical skill.
Falls back against the harpoon crossbow but quickly mans it to face Ukafa threatening to kill him with a spear.
Does not flinch when Tamara screams in his face but proceeds to take her from hiding to safety.
Refuses to leave Tamara alone on the pirate ship despite not officially taking her to Khor Kalba.
Shakes his head at Tamara's claim about virginity without mockery or reprimand.
Focuses on practical matters (escaping and resting) without visible emotional connection or warmth towards companions.
Mans the harpoon with precision, effectively kills Ukafa by throwing him into the sea.
Does not flinch when Tamara screams right in his face, maintaining calm and control.
Makes a strategic decision to send Artus west to draw pursuers away while he finds another path.
Rows the dinghy away with powerful strokes, showing physical capability and determination.
Refuses to state definitively he is taking Tamara with him, showing cautious and guarded communication.
Shakes his head at Tamara's accusations with a casual attitude, implying confidence and social awareness.
Ignores Tamara's pleas and continues gathering wood instead of responding immediately.
Responds to Tamara only after completing his task, indicating a reserved but deliberate communication.
Offers to bring Tamara through Khor Kalba despite the danger, assisting her toward her goal.
States he will not break stride for Tamara, emphasizing focus on purpose rather than companionship.
Ignores Tamara's pleas and continues gathering wood to prepare a fire before responding, showing focus and discipline.
Starts the fire efficiently using flint and only answers Tamara after the task is complete, demonstrating skill and prioritization.
States that they will leave at dawn and that he will not break stride, showing confidence and clear planning.
Does not immediately comfort or engage Tamara emotionally, which could be seen as emotionally distant or unapproachable.
Kills a boar swiftly and mercifully by snapping its neck to end its suffering.
Notices Tamara's presence and appearance but respects her privacy when she becomes embarrassed.
Answers Tamara's questions openly about his tribe and mother, sharing personal information.
Silently stalks prey with only a knife, intercepts boar quickly, leaps over a log, and kills the boar efficiently with a dagger through the jugular, then mercifully snaps its neck.
Turns meat over fire while eating, showing practical survival skills.
Notices Tamara and stops chewing, distracted by her presence.
States 'I don't lie' confidently when asked about a dire situation.
Shows gentleness and control during an intimate moment despite his broad and imposing form.
Responds irritably, saying 'Do you ever tire of talking? Let me rest, woman.' when asked a thoughtful question.
Accepts Tamara's faith and affection, shares an intimate moment.
Suggests a disguise for Tamara, explaining the need to dress differently for the mission.
Responds to Tamara's complaint about her disguise with a teasing comment.
Powers his way to the top of a high ridge to scout the fortress and caravan below, showing strategic reconnaissance.
Formulates a plan to slip into the city disguised as traders and decides on changing Tamara's clothes to avoid attention.
Chooses appropriate disguises for himself and Tamara based on roles—he dresses as a desert trader, she as a serving girl—anticipating social perceptions.
Remains calm and in control while managing the camel despite it rearing up, quickly taking command to move forward.
Dismisses Tamara's objection to her disguise with a sarcastic remark, potentially risking morale.
Analyzes the security of the fortress entrance, noting that the winch and the cliff are heavily guarded both day and night.
Recognizes that climbing the cliff during day or night is futile, demonstrating strategic and realistic thinking.
Refuses to rush into a dangerous climb and instead insists on finding another way.
Immediately draws sword and prepares for combat when ambushed by thieves, showing readiness and confidence.
Saves the One-Eyed Thief from Lucius' beatings, earning his gratitude.
Smiles and enjoys the attention of the serving women, showing playful friendliness.
Teases Tamara by inviting her to join the serving women, showing humor and casual tolerance.
Shows calm and confident reaction to being surrounded by thieves and women, enjoys their company without losing composure.
Listens attentively and questions the One-Eyed Thief's explanation of the fortress's defenses, showing engagement and analytical thinking.
Encourages the group to follow him into the dangerous sewers despite warnings.
Shows disregard for warnings about dangers in the catacombs, saying 'Not from me.'
Leads others through a hazardous environment, protecting and guiding the group.
Presses on into dangerous and unknown catacombs despite warnings and eerie signs, showing confidence and determination.
Nods respectfully to One Eyed Thief when they decide to stop, allowing them to leave peacefully.
Flicks a slimy slug off Tamara's leg, showing attentiveness to her discomfort.
Dismisses Tamara's alarm by saying 'Crom! Stop wasting time.', showing brusqueness and impatience.
Immediately slashes the tentacle to save Tamara.
Leads Tamara up the circular stairwell with a sense of urgency and protection.
Immediately slashes the tentacle attacking Tamara, saving her from being pulled underwater.
Quickly locates and ascends a circular stone staircase to escape danger.
Holds up his torch to peer into the dark dungeon despite oppressive surroundings, demonstrating situational awareness.
Comments insightfully that 'Nothing good' lies ahead, showing intuition and understanding of danger.
Takes a step forward cautiously even after his torch is extinguished, displaying calm but alert behavior.
Tells Tamara to stay behind him and blocks the attackers' path to protect her.
Commands Tamara to stay behind him, showing protective and strategic instinct.
Deftly steps aside a pike thrust and uses the opponent's momentum to send him into the abyss.
Evades a short sword attack and decapitates the attacker with a single blow.
Immediately turns back to check on Tamara after cutting off the tentacle, showing concern for her safety.
Tries to keep beneath Tamara as she climbs down, evading danger to protect and assist her.
Reaches out to grab Tamara by the arm as she falls, actively saving her from harm.
Grabs Tamara as she falls, risking injury to save her.
Swings Tamara to safety at edge of pit.
Focuses on fighting Akhun immediately after saving Tamara; no direct emotional response to Tamara's condition shown in text.
Questions the monk group's plan to fight Khalar's troops alone, showing skepticism about their capability.
Keeps his word to Tamara, demonstrating reliability and confidence in handling his commitments.
Shakes his head at the rag-tag group preparing for battle, indicating doubt about their fighting ability compared to his own experience.
Steps out from darkness to confront the Guard, offering to ask questions to gain information.
Quickly dodges an arrow to protect himself and others, showing vigilance and protective instincts.
Does not show hesitation in a tense situation but does not escalate violence unnecessarily in this excerpt.
Says nothing when insulted but scans room carefully, shows calmness under pressure.
Threatens Fariq with 'A swift end!'
Strains against shackles despite pain, refuses to beg or show weakness.
His eyes scan the room, taking in everything despite being chained and weakened.
Strains at the chains, ripping the skin beneath his shackles and causing part of the mortar to come loose.
Says nothing initially but responds with confident defiance when challenged.
Fails to immediately escape from shackles or gain advantage despite physical effort, remains restrained.
Remains silent witnessing his father's death, enduring pain without complaint.
Challenges Fariq with insults and provokes violence.
Remains silent despite pain, notices a loose brick, uses the chain and mortar as a weapon, and defeats the guards.
Yells back at Fariq when the hot blade is pressed against him.
Encircles Fariq's neck with steel bonds and chokes him but does not kill him immediately.
Uses force lethally against guards and foes, aggressively swinging chain and crushing heads.
No direct action or statement present in this excerpt to assess competence.
Persists despite severe wounds and exhaustion, attempts to force open large doors using physical strength before considering alternative actions.
After failing to open the doors, backs away and climbs the rock to assess the situation from a different vantage point.
Climbs the skull despite extreme difficulty and danger to reach Tamara, showing determination to intervene.
Interrupts a brutal ritual and confronts the antagonist, attempting to save Tamara from suffering.
Leaps down onto the killing floor to fight guardsmen and protect Tamara.
Demands 'Let her go' showing concern for Tamara’s life.
Rushes to Tamara’s side and tries to lift her off the altar despite the danger.
Uses the severed head of Khalar’s son to distract and gain an advantage.
Shatters the bone shackles binding Tamara, freeing her wrists despite the danger from Khalar Singh.
Sidesteps Khalar's attack and shatters the bone shackle on Tamara's wrist.
Throws Khalar off him, knocking the warlord back ten feet and capitalizing on Khalar's feral, uncontrolled attacks.
Continues to fight with polished skill, meeting Khalar's next strike and repelling attacks, even drawing blood.
Quickly moves to reach Tamara, who is shackled and near danger.
Grabs onto rocks to prevent falling during the cave collapse, demonstrates physical skill and presence of mind in a life-threatening situation.
Scales the cave wall quickly to reach Tamara despite the dangerous environment, showing agility, focus, and determination.
Climbs rapidly and skillfully to reach Tamara, leaping across chasms from statue to statue.
Intercepts at a critical moment, approaching Tamara while enemy forces close on Khalar Singh's guardsmen.
Focuses on fighting Khalar and does not immediately intervene to protect Tamara when she is seized by the Acheronian Commander.
Glances down at Tamara when she calls out, showing some awareness and possible concern.
Leaps across chasms with dizzying climbing skill, parries attacks, waits patiently for the right moment to strike, and successfully wounds Khalar causing him to lose balance.
Glances down momentarily when Tamara calls out, showing some distraction at a critical moment.
Leaps into battle to save Tamara, fights through injury, and refuses to kill her despite her urging.
Eventually kills Tamara to save others despite his personal feelings.
Carefully places Tamara's lifeless body atop the horse and embraces her protectively.
Gives Tamara's body one last kiss, showing deep affection and sorrow.
Ritually burns Tamara's body on a funeral pyre with solemn respect.
Displays a hard, grim expression with a blazing, unextinguished fire in his eyes, indicating emotional pain mixed with determination.
Drives his sword into Tamara's heart, effectively neutralizing a threat.
Carefully places Tamara's body atop the horse and mounts it himself, showing practical skill and attention to detail under pressure.
Responds to chaotic, collapsing environment by successfully extracting himself and Tamara's body.
Performs funeral rites with solemnity and intention, indicating emotional control and respect, though this is less about skill and more about internal discipline.
Quickly punches the hulking teen in the throat to neutralize the threat.
Chooses the more difficult cliff face route to climb, demonstrating strategic risk-taking and confidence.
Finds alternate handholds mid-climb when blocked, showing adaptability and skill.
Pauses upon spotting movement ahead, showing caution and awareness.
